content:
Diagnosis:	Triple negative left breast cancer - pleomorphic lobular carcinoma with chest wall invasion and axillary nodal disease. Progression with pleural and pulmonary metastases.

Initial presentation March 2023 with 8cm left breast mass and fixed axillary nodes. Core biopsy confirmed grade 3 pleomorphic lobular carcinoma, triple negative disease with PDL1 90%.

Received 6 cycles carboplatin/paclitaxel/pembrolizumab March-August 2023 with initial partial response but subsequent progression. CT October 2023 showed new bilateral pulmonary metastases and left pleural effusion requiring pleural drain.

Commenced second-line gemcitabine/carboplatin November 2023 but treatment poorly tolerated with grade 3 thrombocytopenia requiring two dose reductions and three treatment delays. Latest CT chest/abdomen/pelvis shows disease progression with increasing size and number of pulmonary metastases and re-accumulation of left pleural effusion.

Seen today with worsening breathlessness, now requiring oxygen 2L/min. Performance status deteriorated to ECOG 3. Examination shows reduced air entry left base, dull to percussion. Chest wall disease remains evident with peau d'orange and satellite nodules.

Discussed case at this morning's MDT. Given poor tolerance of previous chemotherapy and declining performance status, recommendation is for discontinuation of systemic treatment and referral to palliative care team. Have discussed this sensitively with [redacted name] and family today. They understand the situation and agree with focusing on symptom control.

Plan: Discontinue chemotherapy, urgent palliative care referral completed, arrange community oxygen assessment, follow up with palliative team next week. GP updated by telephone regarding change in treatment intent.
